intro: Polygala amarella subsp. amblyptera, commonly known as the narrow-leaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. This subspecies is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
